trans-unit.source: Azure will determine that your application uses Python **if both of these conditions are true**:
trans-unit.target: Azure will determine that your application uses Python **if both of these conditions are true**:

trans-unit.source: requirements.txt file in the root folder
trans-unit.target: requirements.txt file in the root folder

trans-unit.source: any .py file in the root folder OR a runtime.txt that specifies python
trans-unit.target: any .py file in the root folder OR a runtime.txt that specifies python

trans-unit.source: When that's the case, it will use a Python specific deployment script, which performs the standard synchronization of files, as well as additional Python operations such as:
trans-unit.target: When that's the case, it will use a Python specific deployment script, which performs the standard synchronization of files, as well as additional Python operations such as:

trans-unit.source: Installation of packages listed in requirements.txt using pip
trans-unit.target: Installation of packages listed in requirements.txt using pip

trans-unit.source: Creation of the appropriate web.config based on the selected Python version.
trans-unit.target: Creation of the appropriate web.config based on the selected Python version.

trans-unit.source: Collect static files for Django applications
trans-unit.target: Collect static files for Django applications
